JUDGES: Angelika Nußberger;Dean Spielmann;Elisabet Fura;Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Mykhaylo Buromenskiy
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . On DATE the applicant authorised PERSON , his mother , to represent him before ORG . The applicant ’s mother in her turn was represented by PERSON PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE , and by PERSON .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the applicant , may be summarised as follows .

According to the applicant ’s mother , on DATE she lodged a complaint with the Suvorivsky ORG ( ORG районний відділ ORG міського управління GPE внутрішніх справ PERSON області ) that a certain teenager had beaten up the applicant , a minor at that time . No copy of this complaint is available .
On DATE the applicant tried to commit suicide by jumping from the roof of a multi - storey building . He survived , but suffered numerous serious injuries , and is now physically disabled .
According to the applicant , he was being bullied by a certain DATE , who extorted money from him and beat him up .

According to the Government , the fact that the applicant had fallen from the roof was noted in a register of reported offences of the Suvorivsky ORG ( журнал реєстрації повідомлень про злочини ) and all the necessary investigations were carried out . It was decided not to institute criminal proceedings .
On DATE the ORG , following “ an additional verification ” , again decided not to institute criminal proceedings .

On DATE this decision was quashed by a prosecutor , allegedly following a complaint by the applicant ’s mother on DATE , and the case was remitted for additional investigation . On DATE the applicant ’s mother was informed about it by letter . No copies of the decisions taken were attached to that letter .

By letter of DATE the applicant ’s mother was informed that on DATE and DATE the Suvorivsky ORG had quashed the refusals to institute criminal proceedings , taken on an unknown date and on DATE , and remitted the case for further investigation . No copies of the decisions taken were attached .

On DATE the Suvorivsky ORG again refused to institute criminal proceedings for lack of evidence of a crime . On DATE the Suvorivsky ORG informed the applicant ’s mother that “ following her complaint registered on DATE , it had been decided not to institute criminal proceedings ” without indicating any dates or attaching any decisions .

On DATE the applicant ’s mother , after an inquiry from this ORG , requested ORG to provide her with copies of the refusals to institute criminal proceedings . In reply , she was informed that on DATE the case file materials had been destroyed , as the period they were kept in storage had expired . No copies of the above decisions are consequently available .

After the case had been communicated to the respondent Government , on DATE a police officer questioned the applicant . The Government state that this questioning took place on the initiative of officials of ORG of GPE , after ORG at the ORG had , in order to prepare observations on the present case , requested the ORG to provide all materials related to the case .

The Government submitted a photocopy of the applicant ’s explanations , written by the police officer and signed by the applicant . It is mentioned there that the applicant owed Y. a certain amount of money . The applicant spent some time at a computer club , met Y. on his way back , then climbed up to the roof of a certain building , and after some time jumped down . Nobody pushed the applicant or incited him to jump from the roof .

In a letter of CARDINAL DATE the applicant submitted that he had indeed been visited by CARDINAL policemen , who had questioned him and his mother separately . However , the applicant states that because of his poor vision and the illegible handwriting he did not read the text written by the police officer , but signed it believing that the police officer had noted the applicant ’s words correctly .
According to the applicant , at the material time he was being constantly bullied by Y. and ORG They beat and humiliated him , so he decided to commit suicide .

“ ... A resolution by an investigator or body of inquiry refusing to initiate criminal proceedings can be appealed against to the relevant prosecutor and , if that ruling was issued by the prosecutor , to a higher prosecutor . An appeal shall be lodged by the person whose interests have been infringed or by his or her representative within DATE of the date of receipt of the ruling .

A resolution by an investigator or body of inquiry refusing to initiate criminal proceedings can be appealed against by the person whose interests have been infringed or by his or her representative to court under procedure prescribed by LAW ... ”

“ Within DATE of notification , a decision of a body of inquiry , investigator or prosecutor not to institute criminal proceedings can be appealed against by an interested party or their representative to the district ( town ) court within whose area of jurisdiction the authority which took the decision falls ... ”

“ An appeal against a decision of a body of inquiry , investigator or prosecutor not to institute criminal proceedings shall be examined [ by a court ] sitting with a single judge within DATE of being lodged .

The judge shall request the materials on the basis of which the decision not to institute criminal proceedings was made , examine them , and inform the prosecutor and the appellant of the date on which the hearing of the appeal has been listed .
Having examined the case , the judge ... may take CARDINAL of the following decisions :
CARDINAL ) NORP to set aside the decision not to institute criminal proceedings and to remit the case for further preliminary inquiries ...
CARDINAL ) NORP to dismiss the complaint ... ”
